intro: Diplotaxis viminea var. praecox, commonly known as early slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in arid gardens.
